div.head: Thomas Corker. Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. November 17 day 1676.
I Thomas Corker of Charles County in the province of Maryland
being
sick in body But of good and perfect memory thanks be to Almighty
god and calling to remembrance the uncertain Estate of this
transitory life and that al flesh mud yeild unto Death when
it shall please god to call doe make Constitute ordaine and declare
this my last will and testament in manner and form following
reworking and admulling by these presents all and very testmanent and
testaments will and wills heretofore by me made and declared
either by word or written and this is to be taken only for my last
will and testament and none other and first being pernitent and
sorry from the bottom of my heart for my sinns past most humbly
desiring foregivenets of all my sins and that my soule
with my body at the general day of resurrection shall rise again
with joy and through the merits of Christs Death and passion
profets and inherit the kingdom of heaven prepared for his eleet &
chosen and my body to be buried in such place wheare it shal please my
Executor hereafter named to appoint and now for the selling of my
temporal Estate and such goods chattles and debts as it hath pleased God
far above my deserts to bestow whom my I doe order give and disphose
the same in manner and form following that is to say first I will that
person or persons what saever shall be well and truly contented and
paid or ordained to be paud within convenient time after my
decease Executor hereafter named.

Item.
Item. I give and bequeath all my hole Estate and personal unto my dear and
Loving wife Elizabeth Corker doe hereby appoint and ordaine her my
heir and sole Executor exception some shall Legaires hear after mentioned

Item. I give and bequeath unto Phillop Rogg one brown mare with
in her forehead called by the name of Brammion foaled which by
her side of the said mare hase one if not to have the next that the
said mare shall bring

Item. I give and bequeath unto Mr. Benjamin Rozer twenty shillings to buy
him aring.

Item. I give and bequeath unto Willam Chandler twnety shillings tp
to buy him aring.

Item. I give and bequeath unto Richard Chandler twenty shillings to buy him
aring

Item. I give and bequeath unto Clement Theballs the first foals that the
black mare brings belongs to my wife called by the name of Madam

Item I ordaine and appoint Clemment Theballs shall goe upon his own
plantation as soune as he would after my wife marries

Item I give and bequeath unto John Theballs one black mare with a blaze in her forehead
called by the name of Bonny & one cow called louckle with all their
increase forever.

Item I give and bequeath unto Thomas Rigg one cow to be delivered to him the
next fall and all my warming cloaths as willis whereof I have set my hand
and seal the day and year above written.

Signed Sealed and Delivered
In the presents of
Thomas Coates
Thomas Davy.
